testsuite.name: Campaign Manager
testsuite.details: This test suite verifies the module Campaign Manager on Expression platform

testcase.name: Test 1
testcase.summary:
Test the scenarii: New campaign => no import / export

Existing campaign with no imported file => main cancel => do nothing

Existing campaign with no imported file => import => import the file + main cancel => remove the file

Existing campaign with no imported file => import => import the file + main update => keep the file

Create campaign => import => import the file + cancel => remove the file + main cancel => do nothing

Existing campaign with no imported file => import => import the file + cancel => remove the file + main cancel => do nothing

Existing campaign with no imported file => import => import the file + cancel => remove the file + main update => do nothing

Existing campaign with imported file => main cancel => keep the file

Existing campaign with imported file => cancel => do nothing + main update => remove the file

Existing campaign with imported file => cancel => do nothing + main cancel => do nothing, keep the file

Existing campaign with imported file => cancel => do nothing + import => import the file + main update => keep the last file

Existing campaign with imported file => cancel => do nothing + import => import the file + main cancel => keep the original file

testcase.name: Test 2
testcase.summary:
When exporting the list of msisdn for a campaign, the file contains a last column with the provisioning_status:

- UNKNOWN_MSISDN

- UNSUPPORTED_RATE_PLAN

- OCCURENCE

- MAX_SIMULTANEOUS

- WAITING_PERIOD

- ELLIGIBLE

Test with criteria Test with imported file

testcase.name: Test 7
testcase.summary:
Create and activate a campaign C1 being simple (e.g. 70% bonus on recharge). Create a model X with provisioning in campaign C1 as an action. Create and activate a campaign C2 associated to the model X.
Test via trafficGenerator :
- Generate a first CDR or event for campaign C2 in order to provision the subscriber in C1
- Generate a second CDR or event on C1 (e.g. a recharge)
 Check the status and bonuses of the subscriber in the customerCare.

testcase.name: Test 8
testcase.summary:
Create a model based on a Rule Engine action. Create and activate a campaign based on this model.
Test via trafficGenerator => generate CDR.
Check the status and bonuses of the subscriber in the customerCare.

testcase.name: ATL Campaign Creation
testcase.summary:
Goal of the test is to verify a simple ATL campaign can be created (Targeting Mode = Opened).

Create an ATL campaign.

-> Check in GUI that this campaign is in the 'Saved' section of the campaigns list with 'Opened' targeting mode

-> Check that this campaign is in DB
testcase.preconditions:
user should be logged

at least one model must be created (if the execution mode of the campaign is 'Model Based')

testcase.name: ATL Campaign Activation
testcase.summary:
Goal of the test is to verify a simple ATL campaign can be activated.

Create and activate an ATL campaign.

-> Check in GUI that this campaign is in the right section (depending on dates,...) of the campaigns list with 'Opened' targeting mode

-> Check that this campaign is in DB
testcase.preconditions:
user should be logged

at least one model must be created (if the execution mode of the campaign is 'Model Based')

testcase.name: ATL Campaign Activation then Pause
testcase.summary:
Goal of the test is

  1. create an ATL campaign
  2. activate it
  3. pause it

--> check in DB the status of the campaign

testcase.name: ATL Campaign Activation then Pause then Restart
testcase.summary:
Goal of the test is

  1. Campaign Paused
  2. Restart it

--> check in DB the status of the campaign
testcase.preconditions: An ATL campaign has been created and activated

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with 'bonus' notification
testcase.summary:
Create and activate an ATL campaign with notifications

Simulate the right event for a subsriber whose language and channel matches with one of the campaign notifications

-> Checkin DB that notification has been sent
testcase.preconditions: There is one subscriber whose language and channel matches with one of the campaign notifications

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber restriction - provisioning
testcase.summary:
Create and activate an ATL campaign with :

  - no profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

Then simulate this event for a subscriber (event based conditions must be verified)

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that subscriber has been provisioned (status = not_targeted_prov)

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber restriction - execution
testcase.summary:
Simulate event corresponding to the event type of the campaign model (campaign model criteria must be verified)

-> Check that bonuses have been given to the subscriber

-> Check subscriber status (if 'Beneficiary' is checked then status must be not_targeted_benef, otherwise status is not_targeted_prov)

-> Check notification has been sent (if any)
testcase.preconditions:
An ATL campaign has been created and activated. This campaign has :

  - no profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

A subscriber has been provisioned for this campaign (cf. ATL Campaign with subscriber restriction - provisioning)

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - provisioning ok
testcase.summary:
Create and activate an ATL campaign with :

  - a profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

Then simulate this event for a subscriber that matches the profile restriction (event based conditions must be verified)

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that subscriber has been provisioned (status = not_targeted_prov)

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - provisioning ko
testcase.summary:
Create and activate an ATL campaign with :

  - a profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

Then simulate this event for a subscriber who does NOT match profile restriction (event based conditions must be verified)

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that subscriber has NOT been provisioned

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - execution ok
testcase.summary:
Simulate event corresponding to the event type of the campaign model (campaign model criteria must be verified)

-> Check that bonuses have been given to the subscriber

-> Check subscriber status (if 'Beneficiary' is checked then status must be not_targeted_benef, otherwise status is not_targeted_prov)

-> Check notification has been sent (if any)
testcase.preconditions:
An ATL campaign has been created and activated. This campaign has :

  - a profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

A subscriber has been provisioned for this campaign (cf. ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - provisioning ok)

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - execution ko
testcase.summary:
Simulate event corresponding to the event type of the campaign model (campaign model criteria must NOT be verified)

-> Check that bonuses have NOT been given to the subscriber

-> Check subscriber status (still not_targeted_prov)

-> Check notification has NOT been sent (if any)
testcase.preconditions:
An ATL campaign has been created and activated. This campaign has :

  - a profile restriction

  - some event based conditions

A subscriber has been provisioned for this campaign (cf. ATL Campaign with subscriber profile restriction - provisioning ok)

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with passed provisioning dates - provisioning
testcase.summary:
Simulate event for a subscriber that has not been provisioned for this campaign. For this test :

  - subscriber profile must match the campaign profile restrictions (if any)

  - the event must match the campaign event based restrictions (if any)

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that subscriber has not been provisioned for this campaign
testcase.preconditions:
An ATL campaign has been created and activated. When testing :

  - provisioning start date and provisioning end date of these campaign are in the past

  - execution start date of these campaign is in the past

  - execution end date is in the future

Subscriber used for this test has NOT been provisioned for this campaign

testcase.name: ATL Campaign with passed provisioning dates - execution
testcase.summary:
Simulate event for the subscriber that has been provisioned for this campaign.

-> Check that bonuses have been given to the subscriber

-> Check subscriber status (if 'Beneficiary' is checked then status must be not_targeted_benef, otherwise status is not_targeted_prov)

-> Check notification has been sent (if any)
testcase.preconditions:
An ATL campaign has been created and activated. Then simulate event for a subscriber so that he is provisioned (status = not_targeted_prov)

When testing :

  - provisioning start date and provisioning end date of these campaign are in the past

  - execution start date of these campaign is in the past

  - execution end date is in the future

  - subscriber used for this test has been provisioned for this campaign

testcase.name: BTL Campaign with eligibility criteria - provisioning
testcase.summary:
Create a BTL campaign and specify some eligibility criteria. Then activate this campaign and force provisioning.

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that :

  - first subscriber has been provisioned (status = provisioned)

  - second subscriber has been NOT provisione
testcase.preconditions:
For this test we need 2 subscribers :

  - first one will match eligibility criteria

  - second one will NOT match eligibility criteria

testcase.name: BTL Campaign with eligibility criteria - execution
testcase.summary:
Create a BTL campaign and specify some eligibility criteria. Then activate this campaign and force provisioning. When provisioning is done, simulate event matching the campaign model criteria for the two subscribers :

-> Check (in DB and in CustomerCare pages) that :

  - first subscriber has received bonuses

  - first subscriber status is updated (if 'Beneficiary' is checked then status must be beneficiary, otherwise status is provisioned)

  - first subscriber has been notified (if notification has been filled in)

  - second subscriber did NOT get campaign (no bonus, no notification, ...)
testcase.preconditions:
For this test we need 2 subscribers :

  - first one has been provisioned

  - second one has NOT been provisioned

(cf. BTL Campaign with eligibility criteria - provisioning)

testcase.name: Test 2
testcase.summary: Goal: Check that non decoded tags prevent the message from being sent. To do so, create a model with real tags and a non existing tag (e.g. ###TEST###). Check that the SMS isn't sent and that a SNMP trap is generated.

testcase.name: Test 3
testcase.summary: Goal: Check the behavior of tags linked to extended DB: only tags linked to the event of the model must be proposed. For instance, for a recharge, the tag related to recharge amount should exist, same for the tag corresponding to the quantity of recharges and total amount of recharges since campaign start. Once this check done for all events, create a campaign model based on a recharge with a notification using recharge amount and the same since campaign start. Check that the notification sent contains the right values.

testcase.name: Test 4
testcase.summary: Goal: Check that tags proposed in a campaign provisioning contain the following tags: ###campaign_start_date###, ###campaign_end_date###, ###subscriber_msisdn###, ###subscriber_profile### and ###subscriber_rate_plan###. Test a campaign provisioning and check the right decoding of those tags.

testcase.name: Test 1
testcase.summary: Goal: Check that a SMS sent to a subscriber with a predefined short code generate a dialog event that can be used in a campaign. To do so, start the SMSC simulator, configure the short code list (dialogue_channels property in the notif section, separated by ';'). The campaign model must propose the dialog event which itself proposes criteria related to SMS short code and SMS text. It's possible to create a campaign such with the following message at provisionning: "Answer YES to 211212 and receive a bonus". Create such campaign and send a SMS from the SMSC simulator. Check also that using an unauthorized short code doesn't create anything in E4O

testcase.name: Execution of the task
testcase.summary:
The task "recurrentCampaign" is launched in the group1 before the provisioning task.

Check that the task create the instance (of the given day) for each recurrent campaign.

If the settings of the recurrence are not valid for the given date, nothing is done.

testcase.name: tester la tache l'exécution de la tache : AggregateAgain
testcase.summary: tester la tache l'exécution de la tache : AggregateAgain

testcase.name: Skip occurence
testcase.summary:
If an occurence is missed, the task automatically increment the occurence of the campaign without taking care of the missing occurence.

 

Create a recurrent campaign (for exemple starting at the 2013-01-01 which create a campaign every monday) :

- do not execute the task between the 2013-01-01 and the 2013-01-15

- execute the task for the date 2013-01-15

The task create the campaign  with an occurence of 3.

testcase.name: Create dynamic profile variable (on criteria)
testcase.summary: This test creates a complex variable in database
testcase.preconditions:
Logged in as admin

Tab Base Management / Configuration selected

step.actions: Click on the Add button of the Profile table.
step.expectedresults: A popup appears in the center of the screen

step.actions:
Input a profile name containing special characters, such as accents or ponctuation

Click on the Add button of the Values table, several times, and input some values

Click on the save button
step.expectedresults:
A popup appears, warning that the variable name contains special characters

No line is added in the Profile table.

step.actions:
Input a profile name.

Click on the Add button of the Values table, several times, and input some values

Click on the Save button
step.expectedresults:
A line is added in the Profile table.

The values column contain the values you've inputed.

The name is correct.

step.actions: Click on the Refresh button at the top of the panel.
step.expectedresults: The variable you create is still there

step.actions:
Go to the Base Management / Profiling tab

Click on refresh
step.expectedresults: The disclosure panel corresponding to the variable you've created shows the expected informations.

step.actions:
Refresh the webPage, log again and go to the tab Base Management / Profiling tab

Click on the button edit of any variable you've created

Select the second listBox, and select Subscriber / Subprofile in the listBox items.
step.expectedresults:
A popup appears in the center of the screen.

Your new variable is visible in the fourth listBox

step.actions:
Go to Campaign / Campaign Models

Click on the Add button to create a new campaign model

Click on the Add button of the table to add a row in the table

In the second column, click on the Add button.

In the first listBox of the column, select Subscriber/subprofile item
step.expectedresults: Check that your variable and its values are there.

step.actions:
In the same tab, click on the Notification button.

Click on the Edit button right to SMS.

Right click on the edition text area
step.expectedresults: Check that the variable is available in Subscriber / Subscriber subprofile

testcase.name: Create dynamic profile variable (on file)
testcase.summary:
This test creates a complex variable in database from a csv file to import enum values from.

Also check steps in Test-34, regarding the criterion and the tag part, which should have the same result with a variable created from a file.
testcase.preconditions:
Logged in as admin

Tab Base Management / Configuration selected

step.actions: Click on the Add button of the Profile table.
step.expectedresults: A popup appears in the center of the screen

step.actions:
Input a profile name.

Select "Import from file" in the subprofile acquisition mode list box.

Import a file of existing subscribers (respecting the format msisdn;enumValue)

Click on the Save button
step.expectedresults:
A line is added in the Profile table.

When selecting "Import from file", the add button of the values table is no longer enable.

After saving the variable, the values column contain the values in the csv file

The name is correct.

step.actions: Click on the Refresh button at the top of the panel.
step.expectedresults: The variable you create is still there

step.actions:
Go to the Base Management / Profiling tab

Click on refresh
step.expectedresults: The disclosure panel corresponding to the variable you've created shows the expected informations.

testcase.name: Test Ruleset
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier qu'un nouveau ruleset créé dans le project Action apparait dans la liste des actions d'un modèle de campagne sans avoir à recharger la GUI. Ainsi, ajouter un nouveau Ruleset dans le projet “action” et tenter de créer un modèle de campagne. Vérifier que le nom de ce nouveau ruleset apparait bien dans la liste des commodités (Action) possibles.

testcase.name: Test Ruleset 2
testcase.summary: But Vérifier qu'un ruleset dans action est bien déclenché dans le flow d'une campagne. Créer un nouveau ruleset dans le projet Action. Ajouter une règle contenant un log de test (utils.log) et créer un modèle de campagne offrant l'éxécution de ce ruleset. Provisionner une campagne avec ce model et déclencher (avec le traffic générator) l'évènement correspondant. Vérifier que la règle du ruleset Action est bien exécutée.

testcase.name: Test ajout, modification, suppression de project/règle
testcase.summary: Test ajout, modification, suppression de project/règle

testcase.name: Test ajout, modification, suppression de project/règle
testcase.summary: Test ajout, modification, suppression de project/règle

testcase.name: Test Ruleset decodage CDR
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier que le ruleset du projet Event Adaptation est bien appelé lors du décodage d'un CDR. Ce projet permet de changer les données brutes d'un CDR avant la traduction du CDR dans les données standardisées de l'extended DB. Dans le cas des CDR ZTE VOIX  d'OCI, la durée d'un appel est dans le champs DURATION. Créer une règle qui teste si le CDR est bien un CDR voix (par le champs event.getEventInfo(“fileName”)) puis, changer la valeur du champ DURATION. Il est possible de mettre aussi des logs (Utils.log(String)) pour suivre l'éxécution de la règle. Vérifier que la valeur prise en compte dans l'historique pour la durée est bien la nouvelle valeur.

testcase.name: Ruleset respectif au type d'evenement
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier que les rulesets respectifs à chaque type d'évènement sont bien exécutés. Créer une règle dans chaque ruleset de ce projet en mettant un log Utils.log(“Dans le ruleset XXX”) et générer tous les évènements relatifs à ces rulesets. Les evènements relatifs à l'extended DB sont déclenchables via de vrais CDR (fichier ou traffic générator), l'event Microscope est générable grâce à la tâche microscope, les evènements artificiels (Campaign Start, following, end) sont générables grâce à une campagne)

testcase.name: Ruleset test 3
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier pour chaque Ruleset que les bon proxy de methodes sont proposés: Pour tous les évènements de extended DB, un proxy du même nom que l'évènement doit être proposé (par exemple proxy call pour l'event call). Ce proxy ne propose que des méthodes relative à l'évènement en cours. Les proxys relatifs aux autres evènements ne doivent pas apparaitre (par exemple le proxy message ne doit pas apparaitre dans le ruleset call). Les autres proxy proposés systématiquement sont: user, event, utils, bonus, campaign. Enfin, un proxy history doit aussi être proposé, il permet d'accéder à l'historique de tous les champs définits dans l'extended DB.

testcase.name: Test Proxy
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier que tous les proxy sont appelés correctement: Créer une règle dans un ruleset (par exemple call) et appeler les méthodes suivantes: user.getMsisdn, campaign.isValidCampaignPresent, event.getEventClass, bonus.getBonusBalance ainsi que call.getDurationCall, call.isCallInternationnal, history.getQtyCall(“this week”), history.getLast_recharge_date(), call.getTotalAmount_call(“last month”). Exécuter un CDR d'appel et vérifier les valeurs demandées dans la règle. Ce test doit être fait deux fois: Une fois sans historique pour l'utilisateur (pour vérifier que, par exemple, call.getTotalAmount_call(“last month”) ne retourne pas une exception et une fois avec les valeurs d'historique mises en place correctement pour vérifier que ces valeurs sont bien récupérées.

testcase.name: Rule Engine au demarrage de l'application
testcase.summary: But: Vérifier l'ensemble des projets créés dans le Rule Engine au démarrage de l'application. Pour cela, arrêter actrule, supprimer le fichier ./conf/data/ruleengine/project.xml et redémarrer actrule. Dans la GUI, des projets doivent être créés automatiquement: Project Action (sans ruleset mais possibilité de créer des rulesets), Project Event Adaptation (avec 1 seul ruleset), Project Event Management (avec autant de rulesets que de type d'évènements définis dans le fichier XML de extended DB + microscope + artificial events)

testcase.name: Tache RangeMonitoringTask : mise a jour des ranges
testcase.summary: Tache RangeMonitoringTask : les ranges sont mis à jours le dernier jour de chaque semaine (retention_week) et le dernier jour de chaque mois (retention_month)

testcase.name: Tache RangeMonitoringTask : version en pre-production
testcase.summary: Tache RangeMonitoringTask : s'il y a une version en pre-production, la tache verifie s'il s'agit uniquement d'un renommage de range et dans ce cas elle l'applique à la table stats-range.

testcase.name: Version en pre-production
testcase.summary: S'il y a une version en pre-production (et que ce n'est pas juste du label à changer), la tache vide stats_range pour le profile et la variable concernée, effectue les splits et les merge sur toutes les tables de stats, et rempli stats_range

testcase.name: Freeze du Collector
testcase.summary: Verifier que le freeze du collector bloquee la collecte des fichiers et que le resume la reprend

testcase.name: Outdated Aggregation
testcase.summary: On outdated aggregation, check stats_subs aggregated values are available

testcase.name: Force provisioning for an UCG subscriber in customerCare
testcase.summary: In customer care, it is possible to force the provisioning even if the subscriber is in the universal control group ( ucg=1 in table subscriber)
testcase.preconditions: logged as a MANAGER

testcase.name: Force provisioning for an UCG subscriber in XMLRPC
testcase.summary: In XMLRPC, it is possible to force the provisioning even if the subscriber is in the universal control group ( ucg=1 in table subscriber)
testcase.preconditions: logged as MANAGER

testcase.name: Rotation UCG : waiting period between two execution of the task
testcase.summary: The waiting period between two tasks is defined in "ucg_waiting_period_between_two_tasks" (system/conf). The task is launched every day but work only if the waiting period is exceeded.

testcase.name: Rotation UCG : ucg ratio to replace
testcase.summary: Each time the ucg task is executed, the number of subscribers to replace is respected : "ucg_ratio_to_replace" (in system/conf)

testcase.name: Rotation UCG : Max duration of UCG
testcase.summary: The maximal duration of a subscriber in the UCG state is defined in : "ucg_max_duration" ( system.conf). During the execution of the ucg task, all subscribers which are in the ucg state for a period (today - start_date) longer than the ucg_max_duration are automatically removed from this state.

testcase.name: Rotation UCG : ucg waiting period
testcase.summary: a subscriber who was in the UCG state could not be again in the UCG state if the period is lower than "ucg_waiting_period".

testcase.name: Verification of units in CustomerCare
testcase.summary: During this test you will verify that units are correctly displayed in the CustomerCare GUI
testcase.preconditions:
You are logged in actrule.

You have a subscriber which have datas for data and voice call, not null.

Go to the customer care tab and search your subscriber.

Check this user's statistics and services, take notes of some values, especially amount_usage in statistics, duration_call and kbytes_downloaded in Services/Data tab

Change properties in system.conf of your database with the following values.

(conversion_currency_name = "francs", conversion_currency_operation = "x*6.55957", conversion_currency_format="#.00").

(conversion_duration_name = "minutes", conversion_duration_operation = "x/60", conversion_duration_format="#").

(conversion_storage_name = "Mbytes", conversion_storage_operation = "x/1000", conversion_storage_format="#.000").

step.actions:
Go to the customer care tab, and search for your subscriber.

Open the disclosure panel "statistics".
step.expectedresults: Currency labels contains (francs). Datas on the line were multiplied by 6.55957 and floats have two digits after the comma.

step.actions:
Go to the Service panel

Open the Voice disclosure panel
step.expectedresults: Check that the datas in duration_call were divised by 60 and have no digits after the comma.

step.actions: In the Service panel, open the data disclosure panel
step.expectedresults: Check that the datas in kbytes_download were divised by 1000 and there are 3 digits after the comma

testcase.name: Verification of units in specific cases in CustomerCare
testcase.summary: This test will assure that if a property is missing in database because the client don't need them, datas are still correctly displayed.
testcase.preconditions:
You are logged in actrule.

You have a subscriber which have datas for data and voice call.

You have deleted all properties like conversion_currency_<> or conversion_kbytes<> in database

The property money_unit is EuroCents and the property float_format is #.00

step.actions: Redo tests 47
step.expectedresults: For each datas, the currency labels contains (EuroCents), and datas displayed have 2 digits after the coma

step.actions:
An HTTP SOAP request is sent to the getAcceptedOffer webservice containing the following field values.

  • msisdn:msisdn
step.expectedresults:
Response contains a list of offers matches the following data model structure:

2.1       Offer Structure

offerId

Offer unique identifier

name

This could include a title and a short description. E.g. “20% of Brussels Airlines: Time to book your weekend trip!”

description

Detailed description of the offer.

type

Network (Mobistar centric), Physical (Mobistar, Partner or Exceptional) or Voucher (Mobistar, Partner or Exceptional)

category

Vertical that the offer belongs to. E.g. Leisure, Travel, Lifestyle, Innovation.

content

Accompanying image for the offer.

startdate

This represents the availability start date when the offer can be presented to a customer.

enddate

This represents the end date when the offer can be presented to a customer.

price

Nominal unit value (not cost) of the offer.

quantity

This is the total quantity of stock available for this offer.  This can be a finite amount (e.g. 20 iPhone accessories) or infinite (e.g. 1GB data).

product

For Network or Physical offers, this presents the product that will be delivered to the customer as part of the offer.

tandc

Description of the various terms and conditions for the offer.

 

2.2       Reward Structure

rewardId

Reward unique identifier

name

Reward name

description

Short description of the reward. E.g. Celebrating your third year with Mobistar.

content

Image associated with this rewards

startdate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

enddate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

status

pending,accepted,expired

usage

This is number of times a reward can be used to convert into an offer.

offersList

List of offers assigned to this Reward

 

2.3       Campaign Structure

campaignId

Campaign unique identifier

name

Campaign name, e.g. Christmas Special, Smartphone Newbies.

description

Detailed description of the campaign.

startdate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

enddate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

reward

Reward assigned to this campaign, containing the offers for the subscriber

 

2.4       Badge Structure

badgeId

Badge unique identifier

name

Name of the badge. E.g. Newbie, Buddy.

description

Short description of the badge. E.g. This badge is in recognition of our 36 month relationship.

content

Image for the badge to be used on the Customer Zone or MyMobistar application.

reward

Reward assigned to this badge, containing the offers for the subscriber

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

enddate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

reward

Reward assigned to this campaign, containing the offers for the subscriber

 

2.4       Badge Structure

badgeId

Badge unique identifier

name

Name of the badge. E.g. Newbie, Buddy.

description

Short description of the badge. E.g. This badge is in recognition of our 36 month relationship.

content

Image for the badge to be used on the Customer Zone or MyMobistar application.

reward

Reward assigned to this badge, containing the offers for the subscriber

testsuite.name: Expression Subsystem Tests
testsuite.details: The following test suite contains all the tests related to subsystem testing. Test cases where Web services are involved will be automated.

testsuite.name: Data Feeds: Customer Base, Parner Data, Lumata Reports, Logs
testsuite.details:
CDR collection will be done through SFTP. LUMATA SFTP client will collect the Data files that will be hosted on the Mobistar FTP server. At least the last few days must be available on that server. It is the responsibility of Mobistar to manage the disk space on the FTP server and keep minimum history for trouble shooting. The scope of this document is to verify and validate:
  • Correct integration be Lumata SFTP client and Mobistar FTP server that provides the Customer Base Data Feeds.
  • Correct file naming and format of the Customer Base Data Feeds
  • Correct event generation and data storage upon Customer Base Data Feeds parsing

testsuite.name: Customer Base Data Feeds Files verification
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test suite is to verify the correct file naming and file format for every Customer Data Feed file agreed.

testcase.name: POSTPAID_TRAFFIC. File format
testcase.summary: The purpose of this test is to verify the correct integration between the Mobistar SFTP and Lumata SFTP client.
testcase.preconditions: Mobistar SFTP configuration details have been correctly set up into the plugin.xml file.

step.actions: Incoming files format for postpaid traffic files being deposited into SFTP Banjul:/P01/mobistar/BSCS.V510/server/WORK/CONSO/FILES/lumata is observed
step.expectedresults:
Files match the following format:
No Field Description
1 MSISDN Phone number
2 Subscriber Type Number of bundles applied to the contrat :
If no contract can be applied, this value is set to 0 otherwise it is equal to the number of bundles ( >=1)
This field defines the number of blocks in the data record
3 Barring indicates if the client is unauthorized to call
0 = no interdiction
1 = interdiction
Now this field is not used, the value is forced to 0
4 Reset barring password flag indicating that the barring password must be erased.
Now this field is not used, the value is forced to 0
5 Timestamp YYYYMMDDhhmmss format
that is the date of the last treated ticket of the contract
6 Code conso Code associated to the type of bundle (Fu_profile)
7 Free Unit Level indicator of application of the bundle :
0 : bundle of “mono Card” type
1 : bundle of “group Cards” type
8 Bundle Unit (2) Code of the unity of measure to the bundle (Fu_profile)
9 Bundle spent (2) number of units consummed in the bundle, or during the month for money-box bundles
10 Bundle (2) (3) ·          To a standard  bundle:
Number of units of the bundle prorated on the active duration of the bundle during the period of invoicing
·          To an Optima  bundle:
Volume of free units the more adapted to the consumption of the client at the time of the CONSO run.
     
11 Bundle product ·          To a standard  bundle:
Number of units of the bundle without prorata
·          To an Optima  bundle:
Volume of free units by default, choosed by the client at the activation of the optima bundle.
·          To a Moneybox  bundle:
Init volume of this month
12 Timestamp YYYYMMDDhhmmss  format:
 
Date of the first ticket including in the bundle. If the date is not available, the field will be filled with «  00000000000000  ».
 
- 
13 Currency Extra Calls ISO code of the money on 3 characters ( by default EUR )
14 VAT For calls outside of a bundle:
0 = H.T 1 = VAT included( by default )
15 Extra calls spent (1) (2) Amounts of consumption outside of all the bundles (value in the definite money in the field 12 )
16 Date bundle renewal date of the nearest invoicing
YYYYMMDD format.
17 Language ISO code of the customer language ( EN, NL, FR or DE )
18 Send flag Now this field is not used, the value is forced to 0.
19 Service Prov. Identification of the SCS Mobistar : ‘MSC
20 Internal code of commercial offer Internal statute book of the |package| service by containing the telephony

<unique_name>_<date>.dat            
where the date has the format:            
YYYMMDDHH24MMSS            
Characteristics of the file:            
·         ASCII type            
·         Text with 1 record per row

·         There is a separator CHR(10) between the lines.

N° Data type Definition Obligatory  Format Length Additional control
1 Technical Type of record = HEADING Y N 2 '01'
2 Technical Type of file Y A 3 ‘REL’
3 Technical Origin application code Y A 4 'C1__'
4 Technical Destination application code Y A 4 ‘IMX_’
5 Technical Sequence number Y N 5 > the last processed
6 Technical Date and time of creation Y D 14 > the last processed
7 Technical Line ending Y A 1 ASCII 10 Code
End Record:            
N° Data type Definition Obligatory Format Length Additional control
1 Technical Type of record = END Y N 2 '99'
2 Technical Type of file Y A 3 ‘REL’
3 Technical Total number of data records, HEADING and END records included Y N 10 calculation of the lines number
4 Technical Line ending  Y A 1 ASCII 10 Code
Reloads:            
N° Data type Definition Obligatory Format MaxLength Comments
1 Technical Type of record  – DETAIL Y A 2 '02' – DETAIL
2 Data Channel Y A 20 LOV ‘RELOAD_TYPE’
Values at set-up:
BANXAFE, ATM or WEB.
3 Data Sub-channel N A 20 empty
4 Data Reload date Y D 14 Date and time of reload;
Format : YYYYMMDDHH24MISS
5 Data MSISDN Y A 20 Unique identifier of the GSM
Format :324XXXXXXXX
6 Data Amount Y M 15 Amount in EUR (2 decimal digits)
7 Data Reconciliation key Y A 22 Reconciliation key will be used in the bank file as well
8 Technical Line ending       ASCII code 10

testsuite.name: Customer Base & Partner data feed parsing
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test is to verify the correct parsing of Customer Base data Feeds files coming from Mobistar sources. To execute the test cases a CDR file shall be deposited into SFTP folder. Interpretor(s) should be able to parse correctly the CDR file, perform the appropiate data insertion actions in DB as well as detecting any error during parsing raising the appropiate errors in log files.

testcase.name: PREPAID TRAFFIC data feed processing
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct reception, parsing, and database update according received values. of PREPAID TRAFFIC data feed files.

Generic Input
A Prepaid traffic CDR file is correctly deposited on FTP incoming folder, file is automatically parsed and processed by collector. Values contained on the processed fields from the file are observed in database.

Generic Output
Database related fields are updated, or incremented according the new received values.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
sFTP for incoming CDR is correctly configured. CDR files are being deposited on the corresponding folder of the FTP.

step.actions:
The following Customer Data Record, specified in the CDR column above, is received inside the Prepaid Traffic file.
No Field Description Format CDR
1 MSISDN   numeric 32495812205
2 NATDUR_D Voice in sec on day “D” numeric 30
3 PROMODUR_D Voice in sec (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 60
4 NATSMS_D Nb SMS on day “D” numeric 10
5 PROMOSMS_D Nb SMS (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 30
6 MDATA_D Nb Mb on day “D” numeric 20
7 PROMODATA_D Nb Mb (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 50
8 CUST_ACT_DATE Activation date date 11/14/1996
9 commscor Churn score, high score= high chance of churn numeric 433.3923055


* Note: Fields used by interpretor are marked in blue the rest of them are ignored.
step.expectedresults: CDR is not parsed since subscriber does not exists in DDBB a new IgnoreTicketException is raised.

testsuite.name: Lumata Reports Data feeds
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test is to verify the correct deposit of Lumata data Feed report files. To execute the test suite the necessary campaigns have to be running and already containing a campaign history to be reported.

testcase.name: HISTORY CAMPAIGN data feed
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct format and naming for the HISTORY CAMPAIGN data feed file deposited by lumata.

Generic Input
A campaign is already running, and a campaign history report file is generated. Capaign history data feed file is correctly deposited on FTP deposit folder, file is naming and fields structure is verified.

Generic Output
Data feed file name matches the agreed one, fields structure and field separator is correct.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
sFTP for data feed deposit is correctly configured. Data feed files are being deposited on the corresponding folder of the FTP.
There is at least a campaign running on the system

testcase.name: FEEDBACK SCORING data feed
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct format and naming for the FEEDBACK SCORING data feed file deposited by lumata.

Generic Input
Expression platform already contains historical data to generate feedback scoring file. Feedback scoring data feed file is correctly deposited on FTP deposit folder, file is naming and fields structure is verified.

Generic Output
Data feed file name matches the agreed one, fields structure and field separator is correct.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
sFTP for data feed deposit is correctly configured. Data feed files are being deposited on the corresponding folder of the FTP.
Historical data already exists into the system to generate a feedback scoring data feed file

testcase.name: LUMATA SECURITY LOGS data feed
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct format and naming for the LUMATA SECURITY LOGS data feed file deposited by lumata.

Generic Input
Expression platform is up and running. Several login, and configuration actions are performed for EXPRESSION GUI, results are observed on the security logs file.

Generic Output
Security log file naming is correct, and contains a report of all the actions performed.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
Security Logs are enabled.

testsuite.name: Customer Care User management, login, and search actions
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test suite is to verify the end to end flow of the customer care user management from the user creation, update and deletion via WS to user login and search actions via URL.

testcase.name: New User WS: Correct CC user login after user creation from CC WS
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the correct customer care user login into the CC Tool after user creation from the Customer Care Soap Web Service.

step.actions:
An HTTP SOAP request is sent to the createUser webservice containing the following field values.

  • username: testmanager
  • userpassword: test
  • userrole: MANAGER
step.expectedresults:
The following response is received from service:

  • description: createUser succesfully processed test-test-test
  • status: OK

step.actions:
MD5-hashed "md5_authentication" is set to true in the "conf" table.
A login action for CC is performed for the previously created user.
To open the customer care: http://<host>/?login=userlogin&pwd=abcd6bd380a05de8529da90782ba677b&redirect=CustomerCare
step.expectedresults: Customer Care login is successfully performed.

testsuite.name: Customer Interface Web Service
testsuite.details: Lumata-Mobistar Hand Project Customer Interface SOAP Web Service

step.actions:
An HTTP SOAP request is sent to the getCampaigns webservice containing the following field values.

  • msisdn:msisdn
  • limit: 1
  • language: language
step.expectedresults:
Response contains a list of campaigns matches the following data model structure:

2.1       Offer Structure

offerId

Offer unique identifier

name

This could include a title and a short description. E.g. “20% of Brussels Airlines: Time to book your weekend trip!”

description

Detailed description of the offer.

type

Network (Mobistar centric), Physical (Mobistar, Partner or Exceptional) or Voucher (Mobistar, Partner or Exceptional)

category

Vertical that the offer belongs to. E.g. Leisure, Travel, Lifestyle, Innovation.

content

Accompanying image for the offer.

startdate

This represents the availability start date when the offer can be presented to a customer.

enddate

This represents the end date when the offer can be presented to a customer.

price

Nominal unit value (not cost) of the offer.

quantity

This is the total quantity of stock available for this offer.  This can be a finite amount (e.g. 20 iPhone accessories) or infinite (e.g. 1GB data).

product

For Network or Physical offers, this presents the product that will be delivered to the customer as part of the offer.

tandc

Description of the various terms and conditions for the offer.

 

2.2       Reward Structure

rewardId

Reward unique identifier

name

Reward name

description

Short description of the reward. E.g. Celebrating your third year with Mobistar.

content

Image associated with this rewards

startdate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

enddate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

status

pending,accepted,expired

usage

This is number of times a reward can be used to convert into an offer.

offersList

List of offers assigned to this Reward

 

2.3       Campaign Structure

campaignId

Campaign unique identifier

name

Campaign name, e.g. Christmas Special, Smartphone Newbies.

description

Detailed description of the campaign.

startdate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

enddate

This represents the availability start date when this reward can be consumed accepting one of its offers

reward

Reward assigned to this campaign, containing the offers for the subscriber

 

2.4       Badge Structure

badgeId

Badge unique identifier

name

Name of the badge. E.g. Newbie, Buddy.

description

Short description of the badge. E.g. This badge is in recognition of our 36 month relationship.

content

Image for the badge to be used on the Customer Zone or MyMobistar application.

reward

Reward assigned to this badge, containing the offers for the subscriber

testsuite.name: Deal Provisioning System
testsuite.details: The scope of this test plan is to verify the correct integration between the IN manager and Mobistar Deal provisioning System.

testcase.name: Functional. Postpaid customer deal provisioning
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the correct request format from IN plugin to Mobistar Postpaid deal provisioning web service

step.actions:
An external commodity has been correctly configured from E4O application.
From Customer Care tool, an eligible postpaid customer is searched, and a bonus is provided to user.
The corresponding HTTP request sent from IN is observed.
step.expectedresults:
Request structure matches the following one.

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<cre:Request xsi:schemaLocation="http://mobistar.be/TAM/CustomerMngt/OrderMngt/ProductOrdering/CreateBasicProductOrder/v1 CreateBasicProductOrder.xsd" xmlns:lan="http://mobistar.be/Common/Language/v1" xmlns:cre="http://mobistar.be/TAM/CustomerMngt/OrderMngt/ProductOrdering/CreateBasicProductOrder/v1" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
    <cre:Order>
        <cre:InteractionDate>2009-03-04</cre:InteractionDate>
        <cre:SalesChannel>USSD</cre:SalesChannel>
        <cre:SalesOrderNumber>HAND_Now()_LumataTransactionId</cre:SalesOrderNumber>
        <cre:DealerCode>INDEP.00001.00821</cre:DealerCode><cre:Items>
            <cre:Item>
                <cre:SalesOrderItemNumber>HAND_Now()_LumataTransactionId_1</cre:SalesOrderItemNumber>
                <cre:Subscription>
                    <cre:Id>32486633903</cre:Id>
                    <cre:CommercialOffer>
                        <cre:BillingMethod>Postpaid</cre:BillingMethod>
                    </cre:CommercialOffer>
                </cre:Subscription>
                <cre:CommercialOffer xsi:type="cre:ElementaryOffer">
                    <cre:Id>204</cre:Id> value defined in the Lumata admin GUI and chosen in a given campaign/offer
                    <cre:Names>
                        <cre:Name>
                            <lan:String>World Coverage</lan:String>
                            <lan:Language>EN</lan:Language>
                        </cre:Name>
                     </cre:Names>
                   <cre:Category>Bundle</cre:Category>
                   </cre:CommercialOffer>
                   <cre:Action>VALIDATE</cre:Action>
            </cre:Item>
</cre:Items>
</cre:Order>
</cre:Request>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

 

Note:

  • Dynamic values will depend on every msisdn provisionned, in a given campaign/offer
  • Mixed values will depend on the campaign/offer model only defined on GUI
  • Fix values will never change

testcase.name: Integration. Postpaid customer deal provisioning. No Retry mechanism when failure
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the correct integration between IN plugin and Mobistar Postpaid deal provisioning web service

step.actions:
An external commodity has been correctly configured from E4O application. From Customer Care tool, an eligible pospaid customer is searched, and a bonus is provided to user.

Mobistar Postpaid Customer web service is interrupted 

From Customer Care tool, bonus delivery status is observed.
step.expectedresults: Since Mobistar Web service is not available, TCP connection can not be stablished and no HTTP SOAP request can possible to be sent. Bonus delivery shows error status

step.actions:
Mobistar Postpaid Customer service is restablished again
Once re-delivery time interval has expired IN connection is observed.
step.expectedresults: It is observed that no new re-delivery of the bonus is sent.

step.actions: DDBB is accessed, and a select action searching for the msisdn is performed over the global.reward_events table.
step.expectedresults: No register remains on the table for re-delivery.

testcase.name: Functional. Prepaid customer deal provisioning
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the correct request from IN plugin to Mobistar Prepaid deal provisioning web service

step.actions:
An external commodity has been correctly configured from E4O application.
From Customer Care tool, an eligible prepaid customer is searched, and a bonus is provided to user.
The corresponding HTTP request sent from IN is observed.
step.expectedresults:
Request structure matches the following one.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:v1="http://mobistar.be/ETOM/CustomerRelationshipManagement/ManageSubscriberOffer/v1" xmlns:v5="http://mobistar.be/ETOM/CustomerRelationshipManagement/ManageSubscriberOffer/v5" xmlns:v2="http://mobistar.be/Common/General/v2">
<soapenv:Header/>
<soapenv:Body>
<v1:Request>
        <v1:MSISDN>32492002820</v1:MSISDN>
        <v1:LanguageCode>FR</v1:LanguageCode>
        <v1:Action>ADD</v1:Action>
        <v1:OfferToManages>
                <!--1 or more repetitions:-->
                <v1:OfferToManage>
                        <v5:OfferID>18</v5:OfferID>
                        <v5:ExtendedData/>
                </v1:OfferToManage>
        </v1:OfferToManages>
        <v1:OrderId>4343250</v1:OrderId>
</v1:Request>
</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

 

Note:

  • Dynamic values will depend on every msisdn provisionned, in a given campaign/offer
  • Mixed values will depend on the campaign/offer model only defined on GUI
  • Fix values will never change

testsuite.name: SMS and EMAIL notification
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test is to verify the correct integration of Cognition platform and SMS-C, for sms delivery, and the correct integration of Dialog Manager and Satisfaction for email delivery.

testcase.name: SMS delivery
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct sms delivery. Messages will be sent from Cognition Platform to SMS-C platform via SMPP protocol.

Generic Input
An SMS message is generated on Cognition platform, and sent via Mobistar route, to SMS-C platform.

Generic Output
SMS message is correctly sent via SMPP protocol from Cognition platform and correctly delivered.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
Mobistar sms delivery route is configured in cognition platform. Cognition and SMS-C platforms are correctly configured and integrated.

testcase.name: EMAIL delivery
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct EMAIL delivery. Email messages will be sent from Dialog Manager Platform to Satisfaction platform via sFTP protocol by depositing a file.

Generic Input
An email message is generated on Dialog manager platform, corresponding file is deposited into sFTP folder of the satisfaction platform. File is correctly processed by Satisfaction, result is verified.

Generic Output
EMAIL is correctly sent processed by Satisfaction platform and correctly received into destination email address.
testcase.preconditions:
System is up and running.
Mobistar sms delivery route is configured in cognition platform. Cognition and SMS-C platforms are correctly configured and integrated.

testsuite.name: TITAN + HTTP Proxy
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test suite is to verify the correct integration of TITAN server via sFTP for image uploading, and the correct integration of HTTP proxy for image accessing once uploaded.

testcase.name: image access via HTTP proxy after image deposit on TITAN server
testcase.summary: This test cases verifies the correct image access via HTTP proxy after image deposit on the sFTP of TITAN server.
testcase.preconditions:
• TITAN server is up and running.
  • sFTP connection has been properly configured.

step.actions:
A file that has been uploaded previously to TITAN FTP server is accessed via URL http://<endpoint>/images/<image_filename.jpg>
  • Following url is opened on Browser http://stgimagemobistar.lumata.int/images/iphone.jpg
  • Following url is opened on Browser http://stgimagemobistar.lumata.int/images/cam.gif
step.expectedresults: File is successfully provided by apache server through requested URL.

keyword.name: TITAN
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the TITAN verification.

testcase.name: Files in FTP directory not listed via url
testcase.summary: The purpose of this test case is to verify that the content of the FTP directory is not listed when accessing to the root folder.
testcase.preconditions:
• TITAN server is up and running.
  • sFTP connection has been properly configured.

step.actions:
Following url is opened on Browser. It is observed that files contained in images directory are not listed
http://stgimagemobistar.lumata.int/images/
step.expectedresults: 403 Forbidden message should be displayed informing the user the lack of permission to list the folder content.

testcase.name: maximum sFTP quota space on TITAN
testcase.summary: The purpose of this test case is to verify the maximum sFTP space of 200MB for image deposit.
testcase.preconditions:
• TITAN server is up and running.
  • sFTP connection has been properly configured.

step.actions: A large file is copied to FTP several times until the max quota of 200MB is reached. Result is observed
step.expectedresults:
An error message should be displayed reporting that no space is left when the 200MB quota size is reached.
452 Requested action not taken. Insufficient storage space in system.

testsuite.name: Expression end to end System Tests
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test suite is to verify the correct system end to end user flows.

testsuite.name: Campaign. Voucher reward offer type acceptance
testsuite.details: This test suite verifies the campaign reward offer display and acceptance based on voucher offer type.

testcase.name: Campaign Creation
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct Campaign creation, for a campaign model based where a voucher offer type is rewarded based on a criteria.

Generic Input
A Model based Campaign is created, campaign criteria is configured and campaign action is set to assign a offer for a voucher.

Generic Output
Campaign is successfully created.

testcase.name: Campaign provisioning.
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct Campaign provisioning and notification.

Generic Input
Previously created campaign is activated, SMS and EMAIL notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
Campaign notifications are correctly sent via SMS and EMAIL channels

testcase.name: Campaign availavility via Customer Interface WS
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the Campaign availability via Customer Interface WS.

Generic Input
Previously activated campaign is retrieved by means of Customer interface web service, using subscriber that matches the eligibility criteria.

Generic Output
Campaign is correctly displayed.

testcase.name: Offer acceptance
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct offer acceptance by customer and notification.

Generic Input
Subscriber accepts the voucher offer displayed on the list of rewards associated to this campaign.

Generic Output
Offer is correctly accepted, and offer status reflects this acceptance. A notification is sent to customer through the configured notification channel, displaying the correct voucher number assigned.

testcase.name: Voucher redemption
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct voucher redemption on a 3rd party partner.

Generic Input
Subscriber correctly receives the voucher via notification channel, and redeems it on the 3rd party partner.

Generic Output
Voucher can be correctly redeemed.

testsuite.name: Customer Optout and commercial pressure
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test suite is to verify the notification when the customer Optouts and commercial pressure flag is received.

testcase.name: Customer Optout from Hand program
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct customer notification delivery when the customer optouts from HAND program.

Generic Input
A customer optouts from hand program. A campaign is created where a campaign criteria is set that makes the previous customer to be included into the campaign. Campaign is activated and provisioning is started. Customer notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
No notifications are sent to customer.

testcase.name: Customer Optout for sms notification, no commercial pressure on email.
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct customer notification delivery when the customer optouts from SMS notification.

Generic Input
A customer optouts for SMS notification program. Customer has a valid secondary EMAIL channel. No commercial pressure flag is set for EMAIL channel. A campaign is created where a campaign criteria is set that makes the previous customer to be included into the campaign. Campaign is activated and provisioning is started. Customer notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
No notifications are sent to customer through SMS channel. Notifications are sent via EMAIL channel.

testcase.name: Customer Optout for email notification, no commercial pressure on email.
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct customer notification delivery when the customer optouts from EMAIL notification.

Generic Input
A customer optouts for EMAIL notification program. No commercial pressure flag is set for SMS channel. A campaign is created where a campaign criteria is set that makes the previous customer to be included into the campaign. Campaign is activated and provisioning is started. Customer notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
No notifications are sent to customer through EMAIL channel. Notifications are sent via SMS channel.

testcase.name: Commercial pressure on email notification channel
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct customer notification delivery when the customer commercial pressure flag is set.

Generic Input
Commercial pressure flag is set for EMAIL channel. A campaign is created where a campaign criteria is set that makes the previous customer to be included into the campaign. Campaign is activated and provisioning is started. Customer notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
No notifications are sent to customer through EMAIL channel. Notifications are sent via SMS channel.

testcase.name: Commercial pressure on sms notification channel
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct customer notification delivery when the customer commercial pressure flag is set.

Generic Input
Commercial pressure flag is set for SMS channel. A secondary EMAIL channel exists for this user. A campaign is created where a campaign criteria is set that makes the previous customer to be included into the campaign. Campaign is activated and provisioning is started. Customer notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
No notifications are sent to customer through SMS channel. Notifications are sent via EMAIL channel.

testsuite.name: Badges
testsuite.details: This test suite verifies the badges reward offer display and acceptance.

testcase.name: Badge Creation
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct Badge creation.

Generic Input
A new Badge is created, badge criteria is configured and badge action is set to assign a offer.

Generic Output
Badge is successfully created.

testcase.name: Badge provisioning.
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct Badge provisioning and notification.

Generic Input
Previously created badge is activated, SMS and EMAIL notification channels are verified.

Generic Output
Badge notifications are correctly sent via SMS and EMAIL channels

testcase.name: badge availavility via Customer Interface WS
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the Badge availability via Customer Interface WS.

Generic Input
Previously activated badge is retrieved by means of Customer interface web service, using subscriber that matches the eligibility criteria.

Generic Output
badge is correctly displayed.

testcase.name: Offer acceptance
testcase.summary:
The purpose of this test case is to verify the correct offer acceptance by customer and notification.

Generic Input
Subscriber accepts the offer displayed on the list of rewards associated to this badge

Generic Output
Offer is correctly accepted, and offer status reflects this acceptance. A notification is sent to customer through the configured notification channel.

testsuite.name: Customer Optout and commertial pressure
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test case is to check the notification on the customer opt out and commercial pressure.

testsuite.name: KPI

testcase.name: Platform Availability
testcase.summary:
ID
Key Performance Indicator
Definition
Assessment Period
Service Level
Penalty Threshold
RT.1 Platform Availability

% of Platform Availability (A)

S: Service Hours (Planned downtime excluded)

D: Unplanned Downtime

A = (S-D) / S * 100

 Each calendar month (pro rated for part months) 99.5% availability (excluding planned unavailability) <99.5% availability

testsuite.name: Success Criteria
testsuite.details: The purpose of this test case is to verify all the points defined for the project to be deemed as a success.

testcase.name: Customer base data reception on regular basis
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the Customer base data reception on regular basis success criteria.
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions: E4O Subscribers database is observed.
step.expectedresults: Daily subscribers data is correctly being parsed and ingested by the E4O system. Historical aggregated data is successfully being generated.

step.actions: CDR files deposit and processing is observed
step.expectedresults:
• CDR are correctly deposited by Mobistar on the agreed time frame basis.
  • CDR files are correctly parsed by E4O system.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

testcase.name: Communication reception by customer: SMS channel
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the Customer communication reception throght the SMS channel success criteria
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
A subscriber exists in E4O subscriber database with SMS and email communication channels defined. SMS channel is flagged as preferred communication channel.
A campaign with a campaign model that targets the previous subscriber is created and activated. During the provisioning phase subscriber communication channels are observed.
step.expectedresults: Subscriber successfully receives a campaign information through the preferred communication channel.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

step.actions: A subscriber exists in E4O subscriber database with SMS and email communication channels defined. EMAIL channel is flagged as preferred communication channel. A campaign with a campaign model that targets the previous subscriber is created and activated. During the provisioning phase subscriber communication channels are observed.
step.expectedresults: Subscriber successfully receives a campaign information through the preferred communication channel.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

testcase.name: Expression information reception by Mobistar
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the Expression information reception by Mobistar.
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
A subscriber beneficiary of a campaign, and badges exists into subscribers database.
Customer Interface SOAP web services are up and and running. subscriber data is accessed, and updated through the different web services defined on the API. Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Mobistar’s Customer Zone is able to retrieve from EXPRESSION information regarding the campaign and badges for every customer through the web-services provided by Lumata, as well as update the e-mail of the subscribers.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

testcase.name: Information of accepted offers retrieval by Mobistar
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the information of accepted offers retrieval by Mobistar success criteria
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
A subscriber beneficiary of a campaign, that has already accepted at least one offer exists into subscribers database.
From Customer care interface the EXPRESSION information related to the offers of the previous subscriber is accessed. subscriber data is accessed. Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Mobistar’s Customer Zone is able to retrieve from EXPRESSION information regarding the accepted offers that has yet to expire (for example to reprint the voucher or check terms and conditions again).

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

testcase.name: Customer acceptance processing: deal provisioning system
testcase.summary: This test case verifies the Customer acceptance processing success criteria
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
A subscriber beneficiary of a campaign accepts a value added service offer that implies the activation of a deal provisioning system request.
Result is observed.
step.expectedresults:
Lumata is able to process customers’ acceptances through the Customer Interface web-services and consequently perform the required action:

  • a. Activate every network offer through Mobistar’s Deal Provisioning System;
  • b. Provide Mobistar’s website with the information to be displayed regarding the deal accepted, if any (e.g. vouchers), through the web-services;
  • c. Send vouchers and coupons to the customer through the desired media for Partner offers;

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA
keyword.notes: This keyword is used for all the test cases related to the success criteria verification.

testcase.name: Retrieval of list of assigned offers

testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
A subscriber beneficiary of a campaign request all the list of assigned, and not expired offers.
Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Mobistar’s Customer Zone is able to retrieve a list of assigned – not expired – offers through the same web-services.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA

• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.

Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Designated partners are able to confirm the redemption of vouchers/coupons on regular basis.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA

• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.

A Mobistar Customer Care agent access the EXPRESSION customer care tool.
Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Mobistar’s agents provided with log in information for MyPartner software are able to access and use the customer care tool embedded in EXPRESSION without the need to login again.

keyword.name: SUCCESS CRITERIA

testcase.summary: This test case verifies the correct Marketing and Finacial team access to Expression reporting and campaign management tools success criteria
testcase.preconditions:
• Integration phase between Lumata-E40 has been successfully completed.
  • Lumata-E4O and Mobistar-Hand Systems are up and running.

step.actions:
At least a user with permissions for campaign management and reporting management is provided to Mobistar Marketing and Finalcial teams. Teams access Expression tool.
Result is observed.
step.expectedresults: Mobistar’s marketing and financial teams are able to connect and use EXPRESSION reporting and campaign management tools with the log in information provided by Lumata.

testcase.name: Prepaid traffic CDR data feed received. Msisdn existing in subscribers database prepaid profile

step.actions:
The following Customer Data Record, specified in the CDR column above, is received inside the Prepaid Traffic file.
The associated msisdn exists into subscribers database and has a Prepaid profile

.

No Field Description Format CDR
1 MSISDN   numeric 32495812205
2 NATDUR_D Voice in sec on day “D” numeric 30
3 PROMODUR_D Voice in sec (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 60
4 NATSMS_D Nb SMS on day “D” numeric 10
5 PROMOSMS_D Nb SMS (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 30
6 MDATA_D Nb Mb on day “D” numeric 20
7 PROMODATA_D Nb Mb (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 50
8 CUST_ACT_DATE Activation date date 11/14/1996
9 commscor Churn score, high score= high chance of churn numeric 433.3923055


* Note: Fields used by interpretor are marked in blue the rest of them are ignored.
step.expectedresults:
CDR is correctly parsed, it is verified that the following values provided in CDR are updated into database:

CDR field LUMATA GUI field name Value
NATDUR_D duration_call 30
NATSMS_D sms MO 10
MDATA_D kbytes total 20

The following Customer Data Record, specified in the CDR column above, is received inside the Prepaid Traffic file.

CDR contains an error in MDATA_D field
 

No Field Description Format CDR
1 MSISDN   numeric 32495812205
2 NATDUR_D Voice in sec on day “D” numeric 30
3 PROMODUR_D Voice in sec (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 60
4 NATSMS_D Nb SMS on day “D” numeric 10
5 PROMOSMS_D Nb SMS (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 30
6 MDATA_D Nb Mb on day “D” numeric 00020
7 PROMODATA_D Nb Mb (with promo tariff) on day “D” numeric 50
8 CUST_ACT_DATE Activation date date 11/14/1996
9 commscor Churn score, high score= high chance of churn numeric 433.3923055

 

 

* Note: Fields used by interpretor are marked in blue the rest of them are ignored.
step.expectedresults: CDR is not parsed since it contains an error. A new ErrorTicketException is raised.
